modules.description: Converts standard streams, functions returning optional values, strings, and input channels into a lazy evaluation structure. Processes elements on demand, supporting character-level and arbitrary data processing. Enables efficient handling of large or infinite data sources without upfront allocation.

Provides functions for parsing and validating structured text formats, including line-by-line scanning, token extraction, and syntax checking. Operates on strings, lists of strings, and custom record types representing parsed elements. Used to process configuration files and log entries with strict format requirements.

Encapsulates lazy evaluation of data sources, allowing on-demand processing of streams, optional values, strings, and input channels. Supports character-level and arbitrary data transformations through a flexible, memory-efficient model. Operations include mapping, filtering, and folding over lazy sequences. Examples include parsing large files incrementally or generating infinite sequences on the fly.
